__label__Other Dear Dr. Kay: 
__label__Other I saw Dalila Haynes today in consultation concerning the possibility of neurosarcoidosis.
__label__Other She comes with her daughter who assists with the history.
__label__Other I will review her history for the record.
"__label__Other She is a 69-year-old right-handed woman who was hospitalized at the Promptcare in July 2103 for evaluation of mental and motor slowing, memory loss, and weight loss."
__label__Other Her daughter notes that she had deteriorated over the course of a month or two.
"__label__Other Her movements slowed down, and she became unsteady on her feet, and her memory deteriorated."
__label__Other This culminated in a fall in July prompting her hospitalization.
__label__Other During that hospitalization a head CT on 7/25/03 was reported unremarkable.
__label__Other (There is mild ventriculomegaly on it.)
__label__Other An MRI of the brain on 7/28 showed a few dots of restricted diffusion in the left thalamus.
__label__Other There was no abnormal enhancement.
__label__Other This was consistent with small vessel stroke.
__label__Other EEG showed generalized slowing of the background in the theta and delta range with no epileptiform features.
"__label__Other An LP showed normal glucose (74), elevated protein (102), lymphocytic pleocytosis (18-20 WBC, 56-69% lymphocytes, 29-40% monocytes, and 2-4% neutrophils) and 0-1 RBC."
__label__Other CSF ACE was normal.
__label__Other Cultures were negative.
__label__Other CSF VDRL was negative.
"__label__Other Because she has a history of sarcoidosis, it was thought that this likely represented neurosarcoidosis."
__label__Other She was started on prednisone 40 mg daily.
"__label__Other Her daughter has noted some improvement in her movements and cognition since starting the prednisone, but she remains abnormal."
__label__Other She has lowered the prednisone to 10 mg daily now.
"__label__Other Reviewing the laboratory studies today, I see that although an RPR was non-reactive, a TA-IgG was positive, and the confirming treponemal tests (FTA) was also positive at the state lab."
__label__Other She and her daughter are aware of no prior history of syphilis.
"__label__Other Other studies during her hospitalization included low serum Na (133) and Mg (1.3), normal vitamin B12, folate, TSH, and ESR (20)."
__label__Other CSF HSV PCR was negative.
__label__diabetes.a1c.before_dct HbA1C was elevated at 8.6.
__label__Other She has a history of asthma going back many years.
"__label__Other According to her daughter, she had a skin lesion excised from near her left eye about two years ago."
"__label__Other Apparently, this showed noncaseated granuloma, and that is when the diagnosis of sarcoidosis was first made."
__label__Other She then had a mediatinoscopy on 4/10/02.
"__label__Other Biopsy of mediastinal nodes showed granulomatous inflammation without caseating necrosis, supporting the diagnosis of sarcoidosis."
"__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct She has type II DM, HTN, hypercholesterolemia, GERD, and she has had a thyroid adenoma."
"__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct Her current medications are prednisone 10 mg daily, aspirin 81 mg daily, troglitazone, metformin, glyburide, sisinoril, pravastatin, vitamin D, calcium CO3, Colace, and an inhaler for her asthma as needed."
__label__Other She is allergic to sulfa agents and to fluticasone nasal spray.
__label__Other There is no history of allergy to PCN.
__label__Other Her parents both died of some type of cancer.
__label__Other There is no family history of sarcoidosis or of neurologic disease.
__label__smoker.unknown She is a widow.
__label__Other She has four children.
__label__Other She used to work for Lowe's.
__label__Other She now lives with a daughter.
__label__Other She has had no recent fever or chills.
__label__Other Her weight has been stable and her appetite good.
__label__Other There is no history of exertional chest pain or palpitations.
"__label__Other There is no history of cough, dyspnea, nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea."
__label__Other She has had no rash or joint symptoms.
"__label__Other Pulse 126, regular."
__label__Other BP 126/66.
__label__obese.mention.before_dct She is obese.
"__label__Other Ears, nose, and throat are clear."
__label__Other There are no cranial bruits.
__label__Other The neck is supple with full carotid pulses and no bruits.
__label__Other There are wheezes bilaterally.
__label__Other The heart is regular with no murmur.
__label__Other The abdomen is benign.
__label__Other The extremities are normal.
__label__Other There is general psychomotor slowing.
"__label__Other She is oriented to time, expect that she gets the date off by two days as Aug 31."
__label__Other She is oriented to place.
__label__Other She is inattentive.
"__label__Other She is able to recite the months in order, but she gets lost trying to recite them in reverse."
"__label__Other She has trouble registering 4 words, and she recalls only 2 of 4 after three minutes."
__label__Other There is no aphasia.
__label__Other She cannot copy interlocking pentagons and her copy of a 3D cube shows poor spacial representation.
__label__Other The visual fields are full.
__label__Other The pupils are 3 mm and normally reactive.
__label__Other The fundi are poorly visualized.
__label__Other .
__label__Other The eye movements are full and conjugate with no nystagmus; pursuit movement are saccadic.
__label__Other Facial sensation is intact.
__label__Other Facial power is normal and symmetric.
__label__Other Hearing is grossly intact.
__label__Other Weber and Rinne tests are normal.
__label__Other The palate elevates normal.
__label__Other Gag is present.
__label__Other The sternocleidomastoid and trapezius power are normal.
__label__Other The tongue protrudes in the midline.
"__label__Other Muscle bulk, tone, and power are normal."
"__label__Other There is a low-amplitude, high-frequency tremor in action and rest."
__label__Other Temperature and pinprick sensation are diminished in the lower extremities with a distally-predominant gradient.
__label__Other Reflexes are normal (2/4) and symmetric in the upper extremities and at the knees and absent at the ankles.
__label__Other Plantar responses are flexor.
__label__Other Coordination is intact.
__label__Other Romberg is negative.
__label__Other Gait and station are normal.
__label__Other Her treponemal test for syphilis came back positive from the hospitalization in July.
"__label__Other Since syphilis, too, could cause noncaseating granulomas, and she has clearly has syphilis at some point in the past which was probably untreated, this raises some doubt about the diagnosis of sarcoidosis."
"__label__Other I will review that issue with you and with Dr, Villalpando."
__label__Other She had CSF pleocytosis in July.
"__label__Other With that and the positive treponemal test (FTA), she will need a full course of intravenous penicillin for presumed neurosyphilis."
__label__Other I will discuss arrangements for possible outpatient management of hatt with a PICC line and outpatient VNA services.
"__label__Other Concerning her need for prednisone, I think that will depend on our interpretation of the diagnosis of sarcoidosis in light of this new diagnosis."
"__label__Other If the evidence of sarcoidosis is not strong with this alternative diagnosis, then we can plan to complete the course of penicillin and taper and discontinue the prednisone and then follow her clinical course, her CSF, and her syphilis serologies."
"__label__Other Finally, from the MRI of 7/28, shows a couple of tiny foci of restricted diffusion in the left thalamus."
__label__Other These are most consistent with small vessel ischemic strokes.
"__label__Other She has multiple risk factors for common small vessel disease and stroke, but in the context of her inflammatory CSF and evidence of prior syphilis, we must also consider cerebrovascular syphilis as the likely cause of this."
__label__Other I would recommend treatment now with a 14-day course of high-dose (20-24 million units a day) penicillin.
__label__Other She is already on prednisone which might help to prevent any possible Jarisch-Herxheimer reaction.
"__label__Other I think that if she remains stable after the initiation of her PCN therapy, then we can plan to taper and then discontinue the prednisone, to follow her clinically and with repeated LP, and determine any need for future corticosteroid therapy on her course."
__label__Other Thank you for this consultation.
"__label__Other Sincerely,"
"__label__Other Keondre Viera, M.D."

__label__Other Hematology Clinic Progress Note

"__label__Other Date of visit:  March 27, 2062"
__label__Other Diagnosis:  Mr. Goins is a 27 yoM with thrombocytosis here for interval follow-up on hydrea.
__label__Other Hematologic History:
__label__diabetes.mention.before_dct Mr. Goins is a 27 yo male with history of type I DM formally without regular medical care who was  visiting family in Maryland and had sudden witnessed seizure activity in late August.
"__label__Other At the time, blood sugar was >500."
"__label__hypertension.high_bp.before_dct Upon initial arrival to the ER in Maryland, he has BP 248/146; plt count was in 800's."
"__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct The patient was intubated, treated for HTN with labetolol and placed on IV insulin and dilantin  and transferred to BMH for further care."
"__label__Other At BMH, brain MRI showed several small areas of infarct read as concerning for embolic CVA."
"__label__Other Embolic work-up included an echo which showed no vegetations, no PFO, NL EF with LVH; TEE without vegetations as well."
__label__Other LP was done and sent for HSV which was negative.
__label__Other He underwent a renal workup which showed nephrotic range proteinuria with labs also notable for rhabdoymyolysis.
__label__Other Renal doppler US showed no sign of RAS.
__label__Other He was continued on abx for his  aspiration PNA.
__label__Other Other parts of the secondary hypertensive work-up were done including evaluation for hyperaldosteronism and pheochromocytoma.
__label__Other The vent was weaned and he was extubated on the 4th.
__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct HTN was controlled with labetolol drip with additional oral agents being added.
__label__Other He continued to have intermittent fevers and was on broad antibiotics which were originally weaned off.
"__label__Other Hematologically, the hct and wbc fell as he was hydrated."
__label__Other Plt count stayed stable in the 600's for several days before increasing on the 3rd gradually up to the 1000's.
__label__Other Retics were depressed at presentation and iron studies were c/w ACD and he was started on epogen.
__label__Other Initially it was felt that his thrombocytosis was most certainly reactive (CRP was >150 with ESR >100).
__label__Other He left the ICU and at this point his WBC trended down and he was afebrile and more clinically stable.
__label__Other But his platelets kept climbing to nearly 1.5 million.
__label__Other A bone marrow biopsy was done showing normal cytogenetics and no evidence for CML.
"__label__Other His bone marrow did demonstrate elevated megakaryocytes, concerning for a myeloproliferative process."
"__label__Other As well, he suffered a DVT in his subclavian/IJ on the same side as a central venous catheter."
"__label__Other Given his thrombocytosis and elevated plt count, he was platelet pheresed twice in the hospital."
"__label__Other As well, hydrea was started at this time, initially at 500mg bid and then escalated to 1000mg bid when his counts were up to 800-900 despite the medication."
"__label__Other As well, he suffered a small GI bleed due to an ulcer."
__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct For this reason he was not anticoagulated but placed upon daily ASA.
__label__Other He was discharged from the hospital in September.
__label__Other Since then he has been followed in hematology clinic.
"__label__Other Initially, his platelets were still in the hi 500's despite hydrea at 1000 bid."
__label__Other His hematocrit was mildly depressed at this point as well (29-31%).
__label__Other He was re-evaluated on 12/05/61.
"__label__Other His platelets were 502,000."
__label__Other An epo level was drawn and his hydrea was increased to 1500/1000mg.
"__label__Other He was re-evaluated on 12/26/61 and found to have a hematocrit of 26.2%, WBC of 2.7K, and platelets of 508,000."
__label__Other His hydrea was decreased to 500mg bid.

__label__Other Dear Usha:
"__label__Other I had the pleasure of seeing one of your clinic patients, Ms."
"__label__Other Wonda Benitez, in my cardiovascular clinic for follow-up status"
__label__cad.event.before_dct post coronary artery bypass surgery and pounding headaches.
__label__Other As you
"__label__Other know, we performed a persantine MIBI recently which showed inferior"
__label__Other wall ischemia.
__label__Other I wasn't sure whether or not this ischemia was new.
"__label__cad.event.before_dct On review of her coronary artery bypass surgery notes, she did not"
__label__Other have her totally occluded right coronary artery bypass.
"__label__Other Therefore,"
__label__Other I suggest that this reversible ischemia in the inferior wall is
__label__Other probably old and was the result of the fact that they did not
__label__Other bypass this area.
__label__Other She did have a LIMA to the LAD and two saphenous
"__label__Other venous grafts to the circumflex territory, the OM and the diagonal."
__label__Other She has been doing relatively well with chest discomfort and I
__label__Other recommended we continue her current cardiac medications.
"__label__Other However,"
__label__Other she has been complaining of pounding headaches and she did have a
__label__Other history of otitis media in her right ear.
"__label__Other Therefore, I think it"
__label__Other wouldn't be unreasonable to refer her to ENT to have them evaluate
__label__Other her ears as a possible source of her pounding headaches.
__label__Other In the
"__label__medication.calcium_channel_blocker..during_dct meantime, I have suggested that she take her nifedipine and"
__label__medication.nitrate..before_dct nitroglycerin in the event that her blood pressure shoots up during
__label__Other these episodes.
__label__Other I suspect that her blood pressure rise during
__label__Other these episodes is due more to anxiety than to intrinsic problem
__label__Other with her cardiovascular system.
__label__Other She will return to see me in
"__label__Other follow-up in three months time, at which time I will check her"
__label__Other cholesterol level.
"__label__Other Again, thank you for allowing me to participate in the care of your"
__label__Other patient.
__label__Other Please do not hesitate to call me if you have any
__label__Other questions.

"__label__Other Dear Vicente, "
"__label__Other Thank you in advance for allowing me to share in the medical care of Mr. Harlan B. Valdez, a 46-year-old male patient with prior polysomnographic evidence of sleep disordered breathing, as well as a history of difficulty in sleep, reinitiation and maintenance and increased early morning awakenings, as well as mixed systemic medical conditions."
"__label__Other HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: As you already know, Mr. Valdez who demonstrates a history of difficulties of sleep reinitiation and maintenance, as well as increased early morning awakenings, has noted an exacerbation of these sleep difficulties, occurring in temporal association with his loss of his wife from pancreatic cancer last year."
__label__Other He is now placed in the unfortunate situation of being a single parent to a 15-year-old son and a 10-year-old daughter and describes a modification of his current employment duties of a set designer.
"__label__Other In particular, Mr. Valdez describes undergoing on frequent international travelling which has bee markedly curtailed as he is tending to his family situation closer to home."
__label__Other He described a history of intermittent snoring symptomatology but is unaware of specific nocturnal respiratory pauses.
"__label__Other He is unaware of a ""restless"" lower limb sensory complaints which may impact on his ability to initiate or reinitiate sleep."
"__label__Other He denies a history of a "" night owl"" personality or circadian rhythm dysfunction which may have played a role with respect to nocturnal sleep disruptions or sleep difficulties."
__label__Other He denies a history of paroxysmal abnormal disturbances or associated narcoleptic symptoms.
"__label__Other Mr. Valdez underwent an initial formal polysomnographic evaluation at the center for sleep diagnostics at Holy Cross on 11/26/05, during which time he was noted to demonstrate a respiratory disturbance index of 81/hour, particularly exacerbated in the supine position and characterized predominantly by hypopneas, with equal distribution during non-REM and stage REM sleep and with associated O2 desaturation Nadir of 88% The respiratory disturbances were predominantly obstructive or mixed hypopneas."
"__label__Other In addition, loud snoring was noted."
__label__Other There was evidence of a sleep efficiency of 88% and a short sleep onset latency of 4 minutes.
"__label__Other There was a predominance of ""light"" non-REM stages I-II sleep, and a concomitant inability to achieve significant ""slow-wave"" or stage REM sleep."
"__label__Other There was also ""alpha intrusions and alpha delta sleep"" evident during the initial sleep study."
__label__Other In addition premature ventricular contractions were noted.
"__label__Other The patient underwent a CPAP titration on 01/15/06, also at the Tenacre Foundation Nursing Home in Boxborough, during which time there was a marked reduction in the frequency of hypopneas (respiratory disturbance index equals 2/hour) with CPAP titrations between 4-6 cm."
"__label__Other Sleep efficiency improved to 91%, a short sleep onset latency was also noted (3 minutes)."
"__label__Other There was once again an increased predominance of ""light"" non-REM stage I-II sleep, with concomitant inability to achieve sustained ""slow wave sleep""."
"__label__Other Since his initial trial of nocturnal CPAP titration (at 6 cm of water pressure) and with various CPAP mask modifications (including CPAP nasal face mask and a Mallinckrodt ""Breeze"" supportive head gear with ""nasal pillows""."
"__label__Other The patient describes associated claustrophobic symptomatology, relative difficulties with sustained nocturnal home CPAP use, and difficulties with regards to CPAP to being and complications by the bulkiness of the CPAP machine in general."
"__label__Other As a result, he has not utilized nocturnal CPAP therapy for a period of time, although he still maintains the CPAP equipment in his house."
"__label__Other Of particular note, and exacerbation of the past year, the patient demonstrates increased early morning awakenings (averaging 2-4 in number) with typical awakenings occurring approximately two hours after sleep initiation at 9:30 p.m. (the patient describes one awakening at 11:30 p.m. and the second awakening at 11:45 a.m., of unclear causative etiology)."
"__label__Other The patient then might awaken at 3 a.m. and be ""ready for the day""."
"__label__Other If he is able to reinitiate sleep thereafter, the patient may demonstrate additional two early morning awakenings after a final awakening at 6 a.m."
"__label__cad.mention.before_dct The patient is noted to have a history of mixed systemic conditions including diabetes, coronary artery disease, depressive disorder, as well as a relatively stable gastrointestinal condition, with no upper GI evidence of gastroparesis."
__label__Other MEDICATIONS:

"__label__Other The routine gait appears to be normal based, without evidence of significant gait dystaxias."
__label__Other No current clinical ictal manifestations are present.
"__label__Other No acute evidence of ""micro-sleeps"" are noted."
__label__Other IMPRESSION:  
"__label__Other Sleep stage/arrousal dysfunction (780.56): Manifested by subjective complaints of nonrestorative sleep, increased daytime fatigue and alternating hypersomnia, and recurrent polysomnographic evidence of ""lightened"" sleep pattern, with increased predominance of non-REM stages 1-2 sleep, and with the presence of ""alpha"" intrusions and ""alpha delta"" component to deeper sleep."
"__label__Other These latter EEG findings have been described in association with subjective complaints of nonrestorative sleep, as well as clinical setting of chronic pain related complaints, depressive or anxiety disorder or intercurrent psychotropics agents used (but more usually associated with benzodiazepine or barbituate usage)."
"__label__Other Sleep disordered breathing: As evidenced during prior polysomnographic evaluations, mostly of obstructive and or mixed hypopnea."
"__label__Other The patient appears largely refractory to a trial of CPAP therapy, particularly in so far as he demonstrates associated claustrophobic symptoms in association with it's usage, despite relatively modest CPAP water pressures (6 cm)."
"__label__Other In addition, he has tried various nasal CPAP face mask, including the Mallinckrodt ""Breeze"" supportive head gear with ""nasal pillows"" and with limited success."
"__label__Other One might consider repeating a polysomnographic evaluation in the future, and if so, utilizing a potential trial of BIPAP titration, which may help to improve claustrophobic symptoms, but the patient will still be left with the issues referable to ""tangled tubing at night"" and issues referable to nasal face mask usage, as noted above."
"__label__Other Relative difficulties in sleep reinitiation and maintenance:  The patient describes at least 2-4 early morning awakenings with difficulty in sleep reinitiation and maintenance, thereby compounding his current sleep problem."
"__label__Other While there would logically be a relationship between his current sleep exacerbations and the recent death of his wife from pancreatic cancer last year, there may also be evidence of other nocturnal sleep disturbances for which a repeat polysomnographic evaluation; i.e."
__label__Other in particular looking for the presence of increased spontaneous arousals or limb associated arousals or periodic limb movements of sleep may be of a special clinical benefit.
__label__Other PLAN:  
"__label__Other In the short course, in so far as the patient describes himself as being exceedingly tired, and unable to perform the routine daily tasks of work and managing a family in the absence of his deceased wife, I have suggested initiation of PRN Zolpidem tartrate therapy, 5 mg tablets, utilizing one to two tablets p.o."
__label__Other q. h.s.
__label__Other PRN for difficulties of sleep reinitiation and maintenance.
"__label__Other The patient is advised to take Zolpidem tartrate therapy no more than 2-3 times per week, in an effort to avoid any issues of physiologic dependency."
"__label__Other The patient was advised against potential adverse behavioral and or systemic side effects of Zolpidem tartrate therapy including  hypersomnolence, gastric upset, loose stools, diarrhea, and or cardiac palpitations."
"__label__Other Pending his clinical response of his Zolpidem tartrate therapy, I then might seek direct treatment for his sleep disordered breathing issues which may include a repeat sleep study with potential trial of BIPAP therapy (in an effort to modify or attenuate claustrophobic symptoms)."
"__label__Other If he proves poorly responsive to trial of BIPAP therapy however, I might consider supplemental O2 therapy at night and, with this in mind a follow up sleep study should have associated end-tidal CO2 monitoring as well."
"__label__Other In the meantime, the patient was advised to contact the sleep disorders clinic for any acute sleep related concerns in the interim."
"__label__Other The patient may also benefit from nonpharmacologic approaches with regards to sleep reinitiation such as hypnotherapy, but I will hold off on these strategies pending follow up sleep disorders clinic evaluation (in approximately four months time)."
"__label__Other Once again, thank you again for allowing me to share in the medical care of Mr. Harlan Valdez."
__label__Other I hope this letter finds you well.
"__label__Other Sincerely yours, "
"__label__Other Yovani Vergara, M.D."

__label__Other To Dr. Estep:
__label__Other I saw Betty Gillis in cardiovascular clinic with Dr. Vicente Noel on 04/22/2085.
__label__Other Betty Gillis is a very pleasant 73-year-old woman who was recently admitted to the Griffin Memorial Hospital in early February 2085 with a right MCA territory stroke characterized clinically by drooling and left hand weakness.
"__label__Other Fortunately, her symptoms have now resolved and she is back to her regular activities."
__label__Other We understand that she has also had previous strokes.
"__label__Other In December 2082, she was suffering a dizzy spell and subsequently an MRI of her brain found a posterior circulation cerebellar infarct as well as a couple of basal ganglia lacunar infarct."
__label__Other She recalls having only V2 clinical events.
"__label__Other She was worked up in the Griffin Memorial Hospital and had a Holter, which demonstrated normal sinus rhythm with minor ectopy only, an echocardiogram, which was reported as essentially normal with the exception of a positive saline contrast bubble study suggesting a patent foramen ovale, an MRI of her head which demonstrated the infarct and marked microvascular disease, as well as a CT angiogram of her head and neck arteries, which demonstrated mild atheroma for the most part with a left internal carotid artery stenosis that was less than 50%."
__label__Other She is referred to us today for an opinion as to how to manage the possible patent foramen ovale.
__label__Other This lady has never had cardiac problems otherwise.
"__label__Other There is no history of atrial fibrillation, coronary artery disease or congestive heart failure."
__label__Other She does not get exertional chest discomfort (chest pain or shortness of breath) and has no history of syncope or presyncope.
"__label__Other She has no history of PND, orthopnea or edema."
__label__Other She remains fairly active despite her ataxic gait.
__label__Other She tells me that she is able to walk several blocks without difficulty and never has any exertional chest pains or shortness of breath.
"__label__Other Moreover, she does not have claudication."
__label__Other Functional inquiry is otherwise unremarkable save for her usual difficulties with psoriasis and eczema.
__label__Other She denies difficulties with heartburn or GI bleeding recently.

__label__Other There are no carotid bruits.

__label__Other A brief neurologic exam reveals dysmetria worse on the left than the right.
__label__Other Impression:  Betty Gillis has had at least four strokes and has documented evidence of atherosclerotic vascular disease and cerebromicrovascular disease on recent imaging.
__label__Other We reviewed the echocardiogram today and we wished to confirm with the reading echocardiographer that it is indeed positive.
__label__Other (It does not look particularly positive to our eyes).
"__label__Other Certainly, if she does not indeed have a patent foramen ovale, there is no issue as to what to do about it."
"__label__Other If she does have one; however, it seems more likely that her strokes reflect her atherosclerotic vascular disease secondary to her atherosclerotic risk factors and that the bulk of treatment should be directed at modulating those."
__label__Other Her hypertension is controlled today.
__label__Other Her dyslipidemia is not bad.
"__label__Other However, the LDL is 76 and perhaps there is some added benefit to increasing her simvastatin to 80 mg p.o."
"__label__diabetes.a1c.before_dct We also note that she has had elevated glucoses in the past, as high as 191, as well as an elevated hemoglobin A1c up to 6.5."
__label__Other It is probably worth having her screen formally to see whether or not she has type 2 diabetes mellitus versus insulin insensitivity only.
__label__Other She may benefit from an oral hypoglycemic.
__label__Other We recommend.
__label__Other We will review the echocardiogram with the reading echocardiographer to ensure that it does indeed show a patent foramen ovale.
__label__Other We suggest that she increase her statin from simvastatin 40 mg p.o.
__label__Other daily to simvastatin 80 mg p.o.
__label__Other We will leave this to her primary care physician to organize.
__label__Other We suggest that she be screened formally for diabetes mellitus type 2.
"__label__Other We will see her again as necessary, but for the time being, we have no plans to perform an intervention on this lady."

__label__Other HPI:
__label__Other 27 yo African American male with recent complicated hospital stay at BMH presents to hematology clinic for first time for follow up of his thrombocytosis.
__label__diabetes.mention.before_dct This 27 yo male with history of type I DM who does not get regular medical care in late August was  visiting family in Maryland and had sudden witnessed seizure activity.
"__label__Other At the time, blood sugar was >500."
"__label__hypertension.high_bp.before_dct Upon initial arrival to the ER in Maryland, he has BP 248/146; plt count was in 800's."
"__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct The patient was intubated, treated for HTN with labetolol and placed on IV insulin and dilantin  and transferred to BMH for further care."
"__label__Other At BMH, MRI showed several small areas of infarct read as concerning for embolic CVA- echo was done showing no vegetations, no PFO, NL EF with LVH; TEE without vegetations as well."
__label__Other LP was done and sent for HSV which was negative.
__label__Other He underent a renal workup which showed  nephrotic range proteinuria; labs also showed rhabdoymyolysis.
__label__Other Renal doppler US showed no sign of RAS.
__label__Other He was continued on abx for his  aspiration PNA.
"__label__Other Other parts of the secondary htn workup were done including evaluation for hyper aldo, pheo."
__label__Other The vent was weaned and he was extubated on the 4th.
__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct HTN was controlled with labetolol drip with additional oral agents being added.
__label__Other He continued to have intermittent fevers and was on broad antibiotics which were originally weaned off.
"__label__Other Hematologically, the hct and wbc fell as he was hydrated."
__label__Other Plt count stayed stable in the 600's for several days before increasing on the 3rd gradually up to the 1000's.
__label__Other Retics were depressed at presentation and iron studies were c/w ACD and he was started on epogen.
__label__Other Initially it was felt that his thrombocytosis was most certainly reactive; CRP was >150 with ESR >100.
__label__Other He left the ICU and at this point his WBC trended down and he was afebrile and more clinically stable.
__label__Other But his platelets kept climbing to nearly 1.5 million.
__label__Other A bone marrow biopsy was done showing no cytogenetics to suggest CML and there were elevated megakaryocytes read as concerning for a myeloproliferative process.
"__label__Other As well, he suffered a DVT in his subclavian/IJ on the same side as a central venous catheter."
"__label__Other Given his thrombocytosis and elevated plt count, he was platelet pheresed twice in the hospital."
"__label__Other As well, hydrea was started at this time, initially at 500mg bid and then escalated to 1000mg bid when his counts were up to 800-900 despite the medication."
"__label__Other As well, he suffered a small GI bleed due to an ulcer."
__label__medication.aspirin..after_dct For this reason he was not anticoagulated but placed upon daily ASA.
__label__Other He was discharged from the hospital two weeks ago and has done fairly well since then.
__label__Other His energy has been good.
__label__Other He denies any fevers/chills/sweats.
__label__Other No bleeding/bruising.
__label__Other No further swelling in his arms/legs.
__label__Other He does have some occasionally blurryness in eyes immediately after taking his anti-hypertensives but no numnbess/weakness/dizziness.

__label__Other Assessment and Plan:
"__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct Interesting case of a 27 yo male with insulin dependent diabetes and apparent untreated HTN who presented with seizure in setting of hypertensive emergency and is found with nephrotic syndrome, renal insufficiency, several small embolic-appearing strokes and has developed marked thrombocytopenia to 1.5 million and had subsequent provoked DVT."
__label__Other He was treated for concern of essential thrombocytosis in hospital with platelet pheresis then hydrea.
"__label__Other Today, he presents looking well and still has a thrombocytosis despite the hydrea."
__label__Other It is still not possible to tell for sure if this is still a reactive thrombocytosis vs Essential thrombocytosis.
"__label__medication.aspirin..after_dct At the moment, we will continue to treat this as ET and will continue hydrea at the current dose and ask him to take aspirin 81 mg qd."
"__label__Other If this is a reactive process, time should be a good diagnostic test at this should improve after he is further from his complicated hospital/icu stay."
"__label__Other At his next visit with us next month we will recheck his C-reactive protein, ESR, iron studies/ferritin for some idea of whether his body could still be mounting an inflammatory response to drive a reactive thrombocytosis."
"__label__Other If his plt count comes down, we will be able to start tapering his hydrea at that time."
"__label__Other Of note, in the near future, we may be able to help determine between reactive and essential process with measurement of the JAK2 kinase level."
"__label__Other In the meantime, he will be meeting with his new PCP and renal physician next week."

"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct HPI: 65 y/o man with PMH of stage IV CKD, HTN, CAD, RAS, DM, who was admitted to the CCU on 1/26 after an episode of bradycardia and PEA arrest at home."
__label__Other Pt was found by his wife yesterday to be complaining of severe chest pain and SOB.
__label__Other She called EMS.
"__label__Other Upon arrival of EMS, pt was in respiratory distress and bradycardic with a HR in the 20s."
__label__Other He was intubated.
__label__Other He subsequently became puloseless and asystolic and was coded for about 10 minutes with 3 rounds of epinephrine and atropine before he regained his pulse.
"__label__Other In the ED, his BP was 230/120 and he was started on a nitro gtt."
__label__Other He was noted to have blood in his OG tube.
__label__Other CXR showed bilateral patchy infiltrates consistent with pulmonary edema.
__label__Other Chest CT showed multiple rib fractures with substernal hematoma and bilateral modest pleural effusions with adjacent atelectasis vs consolidations.
"__label__Other On admission, pt&#8217;s BUN and creatinine were 43 and 4.35, respectively."
__label__Other He was started on a lasix gtt for diuresis without a good response.
__label__Other His Cr started to rise: 4.6 &#224; 4.9 &#224; 5.4 &#224; 5.33 &#224; 6.3 &#224; 7.0.
"__label__Other His urine output continued to be poor, and renal consult was called."

__label__Other Dear Dr. Hodges:
__label__Other I had the pleasure of seeing Peter Joshi in the Cardiovascular Clinic at the Hospital Regional Universitario.
__label__Other This lovely gentleman with ischemic heart disease and 
__label__Other congestive heart
__label__Other failure has been followed in our clinic since the time of his carotid 
__label__Other endarterectomy and cardiac
__label__Other procedure.
"__label__Other At the present time, he notes that he has been very minimally "
__label__Other active because of the
__label__Other flooding.
__label__Other He has had no paroxysms of chest discomfort.
__label__Other He has had no exertional 
"__label__Other neck, chest, arm"
__label__Other or jaw pain.
__label__Other He has had dyspnea on exertion at greater than 4 METS of 
__label__Other activity and he does
__label__Other have mild lower extremity edema.
"__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct His medical regimen includes aspirin, Demadex, isosorbide, Lopressor, "
"__label__medication.statin..after_dct simvastatin, Norvasc,"
"__label__medication.insulin..before_dct Prevacid, multivitamins, potassium chloride and insulin."
"__label__Other On physical examination, his weight is 223 pounds."
__label__Other His blood pressure is 
__label__Other 124/60 right and left
__label__Other arm seated.
__label__Other His heart rate is 54 and regular.
__label__Other Respiratory rate is 10.
__label__Other There is a mild increase in
__label__Other jugular venous pressure.
__label__Other Carotids are without bruits.
__label__Other Lungs are actually 
__label__Other clear to auscultation
__label__Other throughout.
__label__Other Cardiovascular exam is notable for a systolic ejection murmur 
__label__Other but no gallop is
__label__Other present.
"__label__Other His abdomen is soft, nontender, free of organomegaly and bruits."
__label__Other Extremities are
__label__Other notable for symmetric pulses somewhat diminished at the level of the 
__label__Other posterior tibialis and mild
__label__Other pitting edema to the midshin bilaterally.
__label__Other His electrocardiogram is sinus bradycardia with inverted T waves in I and L.  
__label__Other No significant
__label__Other change from prior electrocardiograms.
"__label__Other In summary, Patrick Joshi looks like he is in mild volume overload at the "
__label__Other present time.
__label__Other He reports
__label__Other that he has had renal insufficiency in the past.
__label__Other Before adjusting his 
"__label__Other Demadex dosing, I will"
__label__Other reassess his kidney profile.
"__label__Other MR #45339844             -2-                 February 13, 2071"

__label__Other Mild mitral regurg.
__label__Other Mild tricuspid insuff.
__label__Other Patent foramen ovale.
"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct A/P:  74 yo F with pmh of DM, CRI, Breast Ca, CVA, who is s/p cataract surgery on 09/25/15 presents with two days of unsteady gait, weakness, mild dysarthria and hallucinations."
"__label__Other She has dementia at baseline and has recently had the addition of Diamox, a carbonic anhydrase inhibitor, to her medications."
"__label__Other This could have had the effect of decreasing her intravascular volume, thus leading to a prerenal state and her increased uremia, and decreased renal clearance of her renally cleared medications, thus leading to acute delirium on chronic dementia."
"__label__Other Common causes of delirium include FEN disturbances, infections, drug toxicity, metabolic disorders, low perfusion states, withdrawal from alcohol or sedatives, and idiopathic."
"__label__Other In addition, there is the possibility of CVA, however the MRI and CT were negative and the time course and symptoms are not consistent with a CVA."
__label__Other Of concern though is that she has somewhat atypical signs of delirium such as dysarthria and ataxia.
"__label__Other Metabolic causes of delirium commonly include Na, Ca, Mg, B12, NH3 imbalances."
"__label__Other Her Na, Mg and Ca are wnl."
"__label__Other Her BUN is elevated at 77, which is close to twice her baseline, and in the setting of a fragile patient, this could be enough to tip her over to delirium."
"__label__Other Her glucose was 215 on admission, which is elevated, but only mildly so for a diabetic and not at high enough levels for MS changes to occur."
__label__Other Infection is possible as her WBC is slightly elevated at 12.1 with 78% poly's.
"__label__Other However, there is no obvious source of infection and she has a normal CXR and U/A, likely ruling out a PNA and UTI respectively."
__label__Other She has no signs of infection at the site of her eye surgery.
"__label__Other She could have a bacteremia secondary to other infection or due to her procedure, but without a fever, this is highly unlikely."
"__label__Other Her mental status change could be drug induced, as she is on multiple medications with the recent addition of Prednisolone and Vigamox eye drops as well as Diamox that was recently stopped by the family."
"__label__Other Eye drops generally do not get particularly high systemic absorption, although there is an anatomic proximity to the CNS."
"__label__Other However, cardiovascular drugs, antidepressants, and corticosteroids are all known to induce delirium and she is on all of them, including two SSRI's."
"__label__Other The new Diamox could be enough to tip her over as it is a diuretic and by itself it can cause confusion, and by inducing more diuresis, it can cause a prerenal state, thus decreasing renal clearance of her other drugs and increasing their levels, thus leading to delirium."
"__label__Other Indeed, her baseline Creatinine is from 1.6-1.9 and was 2.4 on admission to the ED and her baseline BUN is from 20-40 while it was 82 on admission to the ED."
__label__Other There is no present concern for drug toxicity and her tox screen was negative.
__label__Other There was no seizure activity noted and her symptoms have gone on too long to be a post-ictal state
"__label__Other Her BP on admission was 115/51 and her pulse was 62, which does not point to a low perfusion state as a cause."
__label__Other She had a recent stress test that was negative.
"__label__Other However, it is possible that she has some orthostasis, which would fit with her recent history of falls at home."
"__label__Other However, this would not cause the delirium."
"__label__Other Her dementia has been developing over a few years and the possible etiologies include Alzheimer's, vascular dementia, pseudodementia, thyroid abnormalities, B12 and/or Folate deficiency, tertiary syphilis and chronic infarct dementia."
__label__Other Chronic infarct dementia is a distinct possibility with MRI of brain showing chronic infarcts in the right posterior frontal and left parietal regions.
"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct Her stasis, DM and high homocysteine levels (18.8 in 2113) are risk factors with PFO for multi-infarct dementia."
__label__Other Plan:
__label__Other Delirium:  
"__label__Other 500 cc bolus of NS, followed by maintenance IVF of 1/2NS at 80cc/hr."
"__label__Other TSH, B12, Folate, RPR, ESR."
"__label__medication.arb..before_dct D/C her HCTZ, Avapro, Atenolol and recheck her lytes in the AM."
__label__Other Call PROMPTCARE in AM for consult re the d/c of Diamox.
__label__Other Seroquel 12.5 mg overnight.
__label__Other Renal failure:
__label__Other 	likely pre-renal given FeNa<2% and response to fluids in ED
__label__Other 	continue gentle hydration
"__label__medication.diuretic..before_dct 	D/C HCTZ, Diamox as likely precipitants of delerium and renal failure"
__label__Other 3.
__label__Other ID: 	 Cont to monitor for signs/sx of infection.
__label__Other None currently present.
__label__Other 4.
__label__Other GI:	Elevated Pancreatic Enzymes: 
__label__Other No signs or symptoms currently.
__label__Other Cont to follow.

__label__Other Dysphagia: consider a barium swallow.

__label__medication.insulin..during_dct      and she was put on insulin by me.
__label__Other Xitlali Xia followed her in 
__label__Other      order to get her on a good dose but then she was lost to follow up as 
__label__Other      she did not come to her appointments and did not return phone calls.
"__label__Other She finally comes back and I am relieved, but she has not brought any "
__label__Other      list of her blood sugars.
__label__Other She says she does take them about twice a 
__label__Other      day and she did write them down but her daughter ripped them up and 
__label__Other      threw them away.
__label__Other She says that they never go higher than 200; that 
__label__Other      they usually are about 110.
__label__Other It was 101 this morning before 
"__label__Other      breakfast, she says."
__label__Other She says it does get as low as 19 and five or 
__label__Other      six times it has been below 50.
__label__Other She does say she eats three regular 
__label__Other      meals but then later in the morning when I asked her if she had eaten 
__label__Other      breakfast she said no.
__label__Other She is seeing a nutritionist this morning.
__label__Other I will check a hemoglobin A1C today.

"__label__Other      important it is that she eat three regular meals, but not sweets."
__label__Other She had been eating a lot of chocolate.
__label__Other She says she has gotten off 
__label__Other      of a lot of this although she does have cravings for it and eats it 
__label__Other      then.

__label__Other      she would like to do.

__label__Other Dear Dr. Peralta:
"__label__Other I saw your patient, Dr. Gipson, in the Cardiology Office today on a somewhat urgent basis."
__label__Other He was recently in Italy last week with very difficult events concerning his father's ill health.
__label__Other His father ultimately died and was a very traumatic series of days for Dr. Gipson and his family.
"__label__Other He developed left chest discomfort, which persisted for a number of days."
"__label__Other He was afraid to take nitroglycerin despite knowing that he should, and therefore remained with chest discomfort for about six days."
__label__Other He was able to be reasonably active and had no exacerbation of his chest discomfort.
"__label__Other He had no nausea, vomiting, diaphoresis, or palpitations."
__label__Other He then returned to the United States and his symptoms have resolved.
"__label__Other Because of these discomforts, he wanted to undergo an additional evaluation."
__label__Other We performed an exercise treadmill test with perfusion imaging two days ago for better understanding of his symptoms.
__label__Other He exercised for 7 minutes and 30 seconds on the standard Bruce protocol to a peak heart rate of 122 beats per minute (84% of maximum predicted for age) and peak blood pressure of 162/80.
__label__Other He stopped because of dyspnea and had some discomfort.
__label__Other The discomfort resolved into recovery.
__label__Other He had no ST segment changes.
__label__Other His perfusion scan demonstrated normal LV size and normal tracer uptake in the lungs.
__label__Other There was normal RV size as well.
__label__Other There was a small-to-medium medium-sized defect of moderate intensity in the mid and basal inferior wall that was reversible.
__label__Other These were no different than the prior study he had in July 2061.
"__label__Other As you may remember, in January 2061, he underwent cardiac catheterization that demonstrated the presence of non-major flow-limiting obstructions and so no intervention was performed."
"__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct His current medical regimen includes ramipril 5 mg b.i.d., aspirin 162 mg daily, Cozaar 50 mg b.i.d., Crestor 10 mg daily, fish oil 500 mg b.i.d., metformin 500 mg b.i.d., multivitamins, niacin 500 mg daily, Plavix 75 mg daily, Toprol-XL 100 mg b.i.d., HCTZ 12.5 mg daily, and Nexium."
"__label__Other On exam today, he is comfortable with a blood pressure of 135/75, a heart rate of 60 and regular, and weight of 189 pounds."
__label__Other Head and neck are unremarkable.
__label__Other Chest is clear.
__label__Other Cardiac exam shows no jugular venous distention at 30 degrees.
__label__Other PMI is normal.
__label__Other S1 and S2 are normal with a physiologic split.
__label__Other There is an S4 and 1/6 systolic ejection murmur at the left sternal border.
__label__Other Abdominal exam is unremarkable without organomegaly.
__label__Other Bowel sounds are normal.
__label__Other The extremities show no edema or cyanosis.
__label__Other Carotid upstrokes are normal in contour and volume without bruit.
__label__Other Distal pulses are normal.
__label__Other His resting 12-lead electrocardiogram demonstrates normal sinus rhythm and normal morphology.
__label__Other I think Dr. Gipson is basically doing very well.
__label__Other I think his chest discomforts for six days while in Italy may be related to anxiety and perhaps the known gastroesophageal reflux disease that he has.
__label__Other I think there is no evidence that the discomfort was cardiac in origin.
__label__Other His exercise capacity is quite good and his perfusion is actually somewhat even improved from his prior evaluation two years ago.
__label__Other I think we can maintain our current approach.
__label__Other I suggest that I see him in a number of months for future evaluation.
"__label__Other If any problems develop in the interim, please do not hesitate to contact me."
__label__Other Thank you for allowing me to help with his care.
__label__Other Kindest regards.
"__label__Other Sincerely yours,"

"__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct                 Pt is an 88 yo woman with a PMH of DM, HTN, mild dementia and baseline anxiety with a hx of falls who was admitted following a witnessed mechanical fall which resulted in a Type III dens fracture and R superior/inferior pubic ramus fracture."
"__label__Other She was seen by ortho, and they recommended use of an Aspen collar for the dens fracture, and no operative management for the pubic ramus fracture."
"__label__Other On 11/15, patient was noted to have a decreased Hct, which was attributed to an expanding hematoma on her right thigh, and she was given 2 U of PRBCs from 9:30am-5pm on 11/15."
"__label__Other Overnight her O2 requirement increased from 2L to 4L, and she was given Lasix in response to a chest X-ray which showed signs of pulmonary edema."
"__label__Other Throughout the day patient became progressively more agitated, and in addition to her standing Seroquel (12.5 mg bid), she was also given two doses of Zyprexa (2.5mg and 5mg)."

"__label__cad.test.before_dct A cath at that time revealed an occluded mid LAD lesion, a 75% ostial OM2 stenosis, a 90% OM4 stenosis, and a non-dominant RCA with a 90% stenosis."
__label__Other His LVEF was estimated at 25-30% with moderate MR.
__label__Other He was discharged home on 9/02/35 to orbit for future CABG.
__label__Other 9/03/35 He was admitted to Natchaug Hospital secondary to recurrent rest pain.
__label__Other n 9/04/35 Echo revealing moderate MR with no other significant valvular abnormalities.
"__label__Other There was segmental left ventricular dysfunction involving the septal, apical, inferior, and anterior territories."
__label__Other EF 55%.
__label__Other There was segmental right ventricular dysfunction involving the apex.
"__label__cad.test.before_dct The plan was for this patient to undergo CABG; however the patients wife was involved in a serious MVA, and with further discussion the decision was made to take him to the cath lab to attempt PCI so that the patient could be with his wife as soon as possible."
__label__Other 9/05/35 He was taken to the CCL.
__label__cad.test.before_dct mid LAD had a 100% occlusion after the D1.
"__label__Other The D1 was a small vessel with an ostial, eccentric, 90% lesion."
__label__Other The OM2 had a 60% eccentric lesion that did not appear flow limiting.
__label__Other The LPDA had a 95% complex lesion in the proximal third.
__label__cad.event.before_dct He underwent stenting of the native mid LAD with a  Xience OTW 2.5 X 23mm stent with an excellent result.
__label__Other This was followed by kissing-balloon angioplasty of the ostium of the 1st diagonal and the LAD.
__label__Other The pre-intervention stenosis was 90% with 0% residual stenosis.
"__label__cad.event.before_dct Finally, stenting of the proximal third of the left PDA was performed using a Xience V 2.5 x 15mm and a 2.5 x 12mm stent."
__label__Other The pre-intervention stenosis was 95% with 0% residual stenosis.
"__label__Other At the end of the case, there was TIMI III flow throughout with no perforation or dissection."
__label__Other The patient remained stable throughout the rest of the admission with no further chest discomfort.

"__label__diabetes.mention.during_dct Impression   52F with poorly controlled type II DM and known neuropathy, nephropathy, retinopathy and gastroparesis, repeated admission for nausea, vomiting, poor nutrition."
__label__Other Found to be profoundly hyperglycemic on admission with BG of 526 with anion gap of 20.
__label__Other Rapidly closed anion gap to 10 with hydration alone.
__label__Other Abdominal pain can be multifactorial.
"__label__Other I don't doubt that this is most likely hyperglycemia with associated gut dysmotility, but differential includes small bowel angina (pain is definitely out of proportion to exam and seems colicky), hepatobiliary disease."
"__label__Other With normal anion gap, I doubt that this is ischemic disease of the gut, but small bowel angina is still a possibility."
__label__Other Recommendations: 
"__label__Other 1)	 Gastroparesis may be in part due to poor glycemic control, we need to achieve better glycemic control to help with gastric motility."
__label__Other a.
__label__medication.insulin..after_dct Would not hold long acting insulin.
"__label__medication.insulin..after_dct Start NPH 30U BID,    dose if NPO"
__label__Other b.
"__label__medication.insulin..after_dct While NPO, have D5 running in IVF once fingerstick drops below 200, especially once NPH started."
"__label__Other If she needs IVF at a higher rate, you might run D5NS at 50cc/hour along with NS or    NS at whatever rate is needed."
"__label__medication.insulin..after_dct c.	Continue sliding scale insulin Q6H when NPO, QAC and QHS when eating, but change parameters to tighten coverage as follows:"
"__label__Other i.	Fingerstick <150, 0 units; 151-200 4 units; 201-250 6 units; 251-300 8 units; 301-350 10 units, >350 12 units."
__label__medication.insulin..during_dct d.	Start mealtime insulin (clearly hold while NPO) of 10U regular pre-breakfast and pre-dinner.
__label__Other Hold if NPO or PO intake poor.
__label__Other She will need rapid uptitration from this point once eating.
__label__medication.metformin..after_dct e.	No metformin for now given GI upset.
"__label__Other 2)	Agree with other therapies for gastroparesis as she had been on as an outpatient, including ativan, reglan, zofran PRN, zelnorm, miralax, colace."
__label__Other 3)	For crude r/o of poor circulation to gut you could send a lactate level and check stool guaiac.
"__label__Other Colonoscopy and endoscopic exams were normal earlier this year, but this does not exclude small bowel angina."
__label__Other Study of choice would be MR angiography or CT angiography of abdominal vessels.
"__label__Other I do not think this is warranted at this point, but ischemic small bowel should remain on the differential."
"__label__Other 4)	With hyperdynamic precordium and tachycardia, would check TSH, though this is almost certainly due to hypovolemia and compensatory response."
__label__Other Thank you for the consult.
__label__Other We will follow with you.
__label__Other Please call with any questions.
__label__Other Will staff in AM.

__label__Other Dear Dr. Stafford:
__label__Other      I was asked to provide a cardiologic evaluation on Mrs.
__label__Other Tinsley with a concentration on her appropriateness to be listed
__label__Other as a recipient for a cadaver renal transplant.
"__label__Other In summary, she is"
__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct a 46 year old woman who has been an insulin dependent diabetic
__label__Other since the age of 29 and has been on hemodialysis since 2083.
__label__Other By
"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct report, her other complications for diabetes include retinopathy,"
"__label__Other peripheral neuropathy, and peripheral vascular disease."
__label__Other In viewing
"__label__Other her present history, she works in the Houghton Mifflin Harcourt learning technology department."
__label__Other Her
__label__Other three times a week hemodialyses are uncomplicated.
"__label__Other She does,"
"__label__Other however,  experience occasional chest pressure with activities and"
__label__cad.symptom.before_dct on rare occasions has had nocturnal angina.
__label__Other These episodes are
__label__medication.nitrate..before_dct relieved by nitroglycerin.
__label__Other Mrs. Tinsley has also noted that with
__label__Other walking she will occasionally get short of breath which is relieved
__label__Other by slowing down.
__label__hypertension.mention.after_dct In addition to diabetes and hypertension which was present
"__label__smoker.current only pre-dialysis, she has been and continues to be a smoker."
__label__Other cholesterol by one report was 228 mg/dl.
__label__Other I don't have
__label__Other fractionations and her family history is unknown.
"__label__Other A report of an echocardiogram from April of 2083, shows mild"
"__label__Other ventricular hypertrophy in the presence of mitral insufficiency,"
__label__Other preserved LV size and function.
__label__Other She had an exercise tolerance test
__label__Other in February of 2085.
"__label__Other On a modified protocol, she went for less"
__label__Other than 4 1/2 minutes.
__label__Other This is equivalent to not even completing
__label__Other stage 1 of the standard Bruce.
"__label__Other With that, she did develop chest"
__label__Other pain and had 2 mm of ST depression.
__label__Other That study was accompanied by
__label__Other both fixed and reversible isotopic perfusion changes in the septum
__label__Other consistent with prior non-transmural infarct with exercise induced
__label__Other ischemia.
"__label__Other As was apparent to those involved, even the non-isotope"
__label__cad.mention.before_dct portion alone was worrisome for high grade coronary disease and led
__label__Other to the recommendation for a cardiac catheterization.
"__label__Other That study was done in Macdonald Hospital and at this time, I"
__label__Other only have the report.
"__label__Other However, from this report, there was"
__label__Other preserved LV function with anterior lateral hypokinesis and trace
__label__Other MR that is consistent with the echo and the thallium studies.
"__label__Other Coronary angiography showed by report, diffuse involvement of"
__label__Other proximal mid-LAD without specific focal stenosis until an 80% mid-
__label__Other LAD.
__label__Other The circumflex was also diffusely diseased and there was a
__label__Other discrete stenosis in the mid section of a large marginal.
__label__Other The
__label__Other right coronary artery was diffusely diseased with a discrete
__label__Other stenosis.
"__label__Other At that time, the recommendation was to continue medical"
__label__Other therapy.
__label__Other Her medical therapy at this time is estrogen replacement with
"__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct prempro 2.5 mg once a day, tenormin 25 mg qd, aspirin one every"
"__label__Other other day in addition to her supplemental vitamins, iron and twice"
__label__medication.insulin..during_dct daily insulin therapy.
"__label__Other In rounding out her medical history, her surgical procedures"
__label__Other have involved the hemodialysis access.
__label__Other She has had one pregnancy
__label__Other 28 years ago without complications.
__label__Other I also elicited a history of
__label__Other some focal arm weakness and occasional slurring of speech.
__label__Other This
"__label__Other was difficult to pin down, but is of some concern."
"__label__hypertension.high_bp.during_dct On exam, her blood pressure was 150/80  mm Hg, pulse 90"
"__label__Other regular, her weight 95 lbs."
__label__Other Her hemodialysis shunt is on the left
__label__Other arm.
"__label__Other There was a right carotid bruit, neck veins were not"
__label__Other distended.
"__label__Other Lungs were clear, PMI was displaced and sustained."
"__label__Other There was an S4, no S3 and there was a holo systolic murmur at the"
__label__Other apex.
"__label__Other Abdomen was benign, femoral pulses were intact, extremities"
__label__Other were without edema.
"__label__Other The electrocardiogram showed sinus rhythm,"
__label__Other diffuse STT changes.
__label__Other There were no pathologic Q waves.
__label__Other Although the focus of this evaluation was originally for
"__label__Other transplant candidacy, I am concerned about her current cardiac"
__label__Other status.
"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct She is a young diabetic woman, symptomatic of both"
"__label__Other shortness of breath and chest pain and on exercise test, has"
__label__Other limited functional capacity.
__label__Other The coronary angiography reveals a
__label__Other presence of multi-vessel disease.
__label__Other Even without seeing the primary
"__label__Other data which I hope to do in the next week, it would be unlikely that"
"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct she would be an angioplasty candidate, given the poor results in diabetics."
"__label__Other Therefore, coronary revascularization for her would be coronary artery "
__label__Other bypass surgery.
"__label__Other Obviously, I would like to review the films first, and speak"
__label__cad.symptom.before_dct with Dr. Upson regarding augmentation of her anti-anginals.
__label__Other I
"__label__Other would also like to add pravastatin at this time, starting with only"
__label__Other 10 mg and obtain non-invasive studies of the carotids.
__label__Other As
"__label__Other indicated, although the focus of this evaluation was her"
"__label__Other suitability for transplantation, the issue of controlling"
__label__cad.mention.before_dct symptomatic coronary artery disease in this young woman became more
__label__Other pressing.
__label__Other I look forward to working with you and the other physicians in
__label__Other her care.

__label__Other Dear Dr. Knapp:
__label__Other It was our pleasure to care for Mr. Osborne to help with his decompensated heart failure.
"__label__Other He was admitted on 07/23/2082, one month after previous admission for abdominal pain."
"__label__Other In retrospect, that admission may have been related in part to GI symptoms of heart failure."
"__label__Other He came in complaining of continued GI discomfort, orthopnea, lower extremity edema, and 9 pounds of weight gain with increasing abdominal girth."
"__label__medication.beta_blocker..during_dct His medications at the time of admission included beta-blockers and ACE inhibitors for hypertension, with no diuretics."
"__label__Other During his hospitalization, he underwent 7.5 kilograms of diuresis with resolution of his jugular venous pressure from approximately 25 cm to 8 cm."
"__label__Other His echocardiogram showed an ejection fraction of approximately 20% with LV dimension of 5.1, enlarged right ventricle with mild decrease in RV function, but severe RV pressure overload with estimated PA pressure 80 plus the right atrial pressure."
"__label__Other After he had his diuresis, he underwent right heart catheterization, which revealed a right atrial pressure of 8, pulmonary capillary wedge pressure of 18, PA pressure of 65/35."
"__label__medication.nitrate..before_dct He underwent a trial with IV nitroglycerin, then with sildenafil."
__label__medication.nitrate..before_dct The IV nitroglycerin decreased his BLANK pressures only by approximately 8-10 mm but he noted a further improvement in his dyspnea.
__label__Other There was no clear improvement with the sildenafil in either his symptoms or hemodynamics.
__label__Other His cardiac output varied between 3.1 and 4.5 on all the medications.
__label__medication.nitrate..before_dct The decision was just to put him on oral nitroglycerin in addition to the other standard heart failure medications.
"__label__Other He also underwent a MIBI looking for any evidence of active ischemia, which there was none."
"__label__Other At the time of discharge, he is walking easily without postural change or symptoms."
"__label__medication.nitrate..after_dct His medications are Isordil 10 t.i.d., Lasix 40 mg p.o."
__label__Other b.i.d.
__label__medication.beta_blocker..before_dct He is on Toprol-XL 12.5 daily.

__label__Other Dr. Keys
"__label__Other RE:Fair, Bill"
__label__Other MR#:220-41-86-4
__label__Other Dear Dr. Keys:
__label__Other Dr. Oates and I saw Bill Fair today with regard to his troublesome 
__label__Other right knee.
__label__Other As you are aware he is a 56 year old man who is a convenience store manager.
"__label__Other He has had a lot of trouble with his right knee over the years, "
__label__Other mainly related to sports injuries.
__label__Other He has had in particular 2 years of pain now in his right knee.
__label__Other It got so 
__label__Other bad 6 months ago that he required large amounts of ibuprofen to relieve that.
__label__Other It has slowly got better since then.
__label__Other At present his main problem is pain in the knee which mainly occurs with 
__label__Other activity but he also has rest and night pain.
__label__Other He has a restricted walking 
__label__Other distance.
"__label__Other With regard to function, he is able to carry out his work with difficulty and "
__label__Other requires periods of rest in the evening on returning home from work.
__label__Other He has 
__label__Other noticed his knee is becoming slowly more bowed.
__label__Other With regard to treatment he has is taking regular analgesia in the form of 
__label__Other Tylenol but has recently noticed blood in his stool for which he is going to 
__label__Other have a colonoscopy in the near future.
__label__Other He has not tried any canes and has not had any physical therapy as yet.
"__label__Other On examination I note he has bilateral varus knees, worse on the right than "
__label__Other the left.
__label__Other He has an antalgic gait and marked varus thrust.
__label__Other He has a marked effusion that does not have any gross swelling indicative of 
__label__Other arthritis.
__label__Other He has a 5 degree fixed flexion deformity and flexes up to 115 
__label__Other degrees.
__label__Other His varus deformity is not fully correctable.
__label__Other He has grade 5 
__label__Other quadriceps power.
__label__Other X-rays reveal marked degenerative changes in his right knee with complete 
__label__Other obliteration of joint space on the right side.
__label__Other I note he also has changes in his left knee indicative of medial compartment 
__label__Other arthritis but his left knee is currently asymptomatic.
__label__Other We have discussed the operative options for him which consist of high tibial 
"__label__Other osteotomy, a unicompartmental knee replacement, and a total knee replacement."
__label__Other At present neither he not Dr. Oates feels that his symptoms are severe 
__label__Other enough to warrant operative intervention.
__label__Other We would certainly reconsider 
"__label__Other should he run into trouble in the next few months aspirating his knee, "
__label__Other instilling some corticosteroids.
__label__Other We have advised him that this will only 
__label__Other provide him with short term relief but may allow him enough relief to begin 
__label__Other some walking and fitness in an attempt to lose some weight.
__label__Other We have organized to see him again in 4-6 month's time at which stage we will 
__label__Other reassess him.
__label__Other Should he run into trouble in the meantime he cal certainly 
__label__Other ring up and make an appointment to come and see us and we will aspirate the 
__label__Other knee and instill some corticosteroid.
__label__Other With kind regards.
"__label__Other Yours sincerely, "
__label__Other _______________________________
"__label__Other Oliver M. Oates, M.D."
__label__Other DD: 07/28/80
__label__Other DT: 07/31/80

__label__hyperlipidemia.mention.during_dct She also has hypertension and hyperlipidemia.

__label__Other Diastolic dysfunction was also noted.
__label__Other There was dilatation of both atria and the right ventricle with mildly reduced RV systolic function.

__label__Other There was reduced cusp excursion with severe aortic stenosis.
__label__Other There was mild tricuspid regurgitation and estimated PASP of 60 to 65 mmHg plus RA pressure.
__label__Other There was mild-to-moderate mitral regurgitation with a posteriorly directed jet.
__label__Other The aortic valve peak gradient was 115.6 mmHg and mean gradient was 77.05 mmHg.

__label__Other I think the main issue is to determine whether there is significant aortic stenosis that may require re-intervention.
"__label__Other On exam, most features are not consistent with severe aortic stenosis, so we will repeat the echocardiogram here and determine if there is severe aortic stenosis in the bioprosthetic valve, and if so, what is the pathology."
"__label__Other Depending on this, we will determine whether the patient needs surgical reoperation."
"__label__Other If so, she will need to have her GI tract looked that first for the source of GI bleeding in order to treat this in preparation for repeat cardiac surgery."
"__label__Other In addition, the patient will be treated for congestive heart failure with increased diuretics, following her inputs and outputs, daily weights, basal metabolic panel, exam and chest x-ray."
"__label__Other Her beta-blocker will be increased due to her recent myocardial event, keeping an eye on her CHF in order to not worsen it."
__label__Other Beta-blocker will be gradually increased given the lung disease and congestive heart failure.
__label__Other Endocarditis will be ruled out with serial blood cultures.

__label__Other Re:  Kenneth Umstead
__label__Other      MR#  401-10-87-8
__label__Other Dear Jac:
__label__Other I saw your patient Kenneth Umstead in the Cardiology Office today and
__label__Other he feels he has actually improved.
__label__Other His primary limitation had been
"__label__Other his claudication, but he feels that he can walk better now than in"
__label__Other the past.
__label__Other We had a repeat evaluation of his segmental leg pressure
"__label__Other and volumes, and these actually were unchanged from a prior study"
__label__Other two years ago.
__label__Other The post volume recordings were normal in each leg.
__label__Other Systolic pressure gradients were present in the right leg
__label__Other consistent with mild anterior tibial/dorsalis pedis disease.
__label__Other No
__label__Other systolic pressure gradients were found in the left leg.
__label__Other These were
"__label__Other unchanged from January, 2072."
__label__Other Mr. Umstead feels that he can be more
__label__Other physically active and is less limited.
"__label__medication.beta_blocker..after_dct His current medical regimen includes Metoprolol 50 mg b.i.d.,"
"__label__medication.calcium_channel_blocker..before_dct Nifedipine XL 60 mg q.d., and Lasix 20 mg q.d."
"__label__Other Of note, in October, 2073, he was found by colonoscopy to have four"
__label__Other polyps which were removed.
"__label__Other Apparently, no malignant cells were"
__label__Other seen in the pathologic specimens.
"__label__Other On exam, he is comfortable with a blood pressure of 122/68, heart"
"__label__Other rate 63 and regular, weight 205 lbs."
__label__Other HEENT unremarkable.
__label__Other Chest
__label__Other was clear.
__label__Other Cardiac exam showed no jugular venous distention at 30
"__label__Other degrees, PMI is normal."
__label__Other S1 and S2 normal but physiologically
__label__Other split.
__label__Other There was an S4 and a I/VI systolic ejection murmur at the
__label__Other lower left sternal border.
__label__Other Abdominal exam was unremarkable.
__label__Other Extremities show no edema or cyanosis.
"__label__Other His resting 12 lead EKG demonstrates normal sinus rhythm, left axis"
"__label__Other deviation, and persisting X waves across the precordium consistent"
__label__Other with his left anterior hemiblock.
__label__Other I think Mr. Umstead is doing quite well.
__label__Other He asked that I see him
"__label__Other again in six months for routine re-evaluation, and I would be happy"
__label__Other to do so.
__label__Other If any problems develop in the interim please don't
__label__Other hesitate to contact me.
__label__Other Thank you for allowing me to participate
__label__Other in his care.

__label__cad.mention.after_dct   for her problem of coronary ischemia.
"__label__Other As you know, Ms."
__label__Other   Adler is a 49 year old woman with four years of
__label__hyperlipidemia.mention.after_dct   essential hypertension and mild dyslipidemia who is
__label__Other   postmenopausal and has noticed increasing symptoms of chest
__label__Other   tightness associated with exertion.
__label__Other A stress MIBI SPECT
__label__Other   study ordered by you demonstrated inferolateral mid and
__label__Other   basal inferior ischemia consistent with a left circumflex
__label__Other   distribution.
__label__Other The details of the study include an exercise
__label__Other   protocol for which the patient exercised for 7 minutes and
"__label__Other   15 seconds for 8.9 mets, with an increase in heart rate from"
"__label__Other   74 to 159 (which is 94% of predicted peak heart rate), and"
__label__Other   increase in blood pressure from 134/80 to 210/80 (with a
"__label__Other   rate pressure product of 33,390)."
__label__Other The test was stopped due
__label__cad.symptom.before_dct   to fatigue and moderately severe chest pain.
__label__Other EKG
"__label__Other   demonstrated 1.5mm of upsloping depression in II, III, F and"
"__label__Other   V4-V5, and there were no noted arrhythmias."
__label__Other Her past medical history is otherwise unremarkable and her
"__label__Other   current medications include estrogen, Premarin, Provera, and"
__label__medication.calcium_channel_blocker..before_dct   verapamil 240mg q.d.
__label__Other A recent lipid panel demonstrated a
"__label__hyperlipidemia.high_ldl.before_dct   total cholesterol of 203, LDL of 142, and an HDL of 39."
"__label__Other On physical examination, she is comfortable, well appearing"
"__label__Other   woman with a weight of 186 pounds, pulse 68 beats per minute"
"__label__Other   and regular, blood pressure 140/82 in the left arm."
__label__Other Jugular
__label__Other   venous pressure was approximately 6-8cm of water.
__label__Other Carotids
__label__Other   demonstrates normal upstroke with no bruits.
__label__Other Chest
__label__Other   examination was clear to auscultation.
__label__Other Heart examination
"__label__Other   demonstrated a normal S1, positive S4, physiologically split"
"__label__Other   S2, no murmurs or rubs."
__label__Other Abdominal examination was 
__label__Other   Page 2
__label__Other   unremarkable.
__label__Other Peripheral examination demonstrated no
__label__Other   peripheral examination and 2+ bilateral peripheral pulses.
__label__Other EKG demonstrated normal sinus rhythm and otherwise normal
__label__Other   EKG.
__label__Other I reviewed the findings suggestive of an obstructive
__label__Other   coronary lesion in the left circumflex distribution and the
__label__Other   probability of her having single vessel coronary artery
__label__cad.symptom.before_dct   disease as the culprit for her chest pain.
__label__Other We reviewed the
__label__Other   options which include medical therapy and/or coronary
__label__Other   angiography and possible angioplasty.
__label__Other I made no solid
"__label__Other   recommendations for her, but suggested that the angioplasty"
__label__Other   approach was a relatively low risk approach which may lead
__label__Other   to curing the obstructive lesion as opposed to medical
"__label__Other   therapy, which would also be a well supported decision, and"
__label__Other   I reviewed the evidence to suggest medical treatment of
__label__Other   single vessel disease does not shorten one's life span and
__label__Other   only affects the quality of life depending on the symptom
__label__Other   tolerance.
__label__Other She and her husband are going to reflect on
__label__Other   these recommendations and get back to me by the end of the
__label__Other   week.
__label__Other If she does decide to undergo coronary angiography
"__label__Other   and possible angioplasty, we will schedule her immediately"
__label__Other   in Cardiology.
__label__Other I have scheduled follow-up in one month regardless to see
__label__Other   her in the office.
__label__Other Please do not hesitate to contact me if
__label__Other   I can be of any further assistance.

__label__Other 2092.

__label__Other failure of unknown etiology.
__label__Other She is six years status post
__label__Other hysterectomy for endometriosis during which an occult
__label__Other leiomyosarcoma was discovered.
__label__Other She has an extensive history of
"__label__hypertension.mention.during_dct hidradenitis, obesity, and hypertension."
__label__Other She had one stillborn
"__label__Other infant, one premature infant, and three spontaneous abortions."
__label__Other SFOC records are unavailable at this time.
"__label__medication.calcium_channel_blocker..during_dct Her medications include Premarin 0.625 qd, Diltiazem 240 qd,"
"__label__medication.statin..during_dct furosemide 40 mg qd, Mevacor 20 mg qd, Calcitriol 0.25 mcg qd,"

__label__Other 250 mg qid.
__label__Other On physical examination Ms. Vincent is a 56-year-old woman in no
__label__Other distress.
"__label__Other Her weight is 101.5 kilograms, or 223 lbs."
__label__Other Temperature
__label__Other is normal.
__label__Other Pulse is 88 beats per minute.
__label__Other Blood pressure is
__label__hypertension.high_bp.during_dct 178/96.
__label__Other There is striking hirsutism and moon facies.
__label__Other There is a
__label__Other buffalo hump.
__label__Other The lungs show scattered wheezing.
