__label__Other exam is normal.
__label__Other There are discolorations of the skin across the
"__label__Other neck, upper extremities, and trunk which are hyperpigmented but not"
__label__Other raised.
__label__obese.mention.during_dct The abdomen is obese without palpable masses.
__label__Other ventral hernia deep in the lower part of the abdomen.
__label__Other The
__label__Other extremities show trace edema.
__label__Other There are several areas of
__label__Other superficial petechiae.
"__label__Other In summary, this 56-year-old woman has chronic renal failure of"
__label__Other unclear etiology.
__label__Other She does report an episode of lower extremity
__label__Other swelling in association with an episode of hidradenitis.
__label__Other ThisRoberta Vincent
"__label__Other MR #380-18-32-2               -2-            November 16, 2092"
__label__Other raises the possibility of a post-infectious glomerulonephritis now
__label__Other in a chronic phase.
__label__Other Other diagnostic possibilities include other
__label__Other forms of chronic glomerulonephritis including systemic lupus
__label__Other erythematosus given the history of spontaneous abortions.
"__label__Other Nevertheless, I agree that kidney biopsy is not indicated at this"
__label__Other time given the advanced nature of her disease and the increased
__label__Other risk due to her body habitus.
__label__Other I discussed several options in renal replacement therapy with Ms.
__label__Other Vincent.
__label__Other Although she has no medical conditions which would
"__label__Other preclude living-related or cadaveric kidney transplantation, her"
__label__obese.mention.after_dct obesity and glucose intolerance along with the history of
__label__Other hidradenitis make transplantation a less attractive option.
__label__Other I have
__label__Other encouraged Ms. Vincent to attempt a gradual weight loss program in
__label__Other order to improve her fitness prior to either dialysis or
__label__Other transplantation.
"__label__Other Nevertheless, her appearance is quite reminiscent"
"__label__Other of Cushing's disease, and this should be worked up if it has not"
__label__Other been performed previously.
__label__Other I have arranged an iothalamate GFR to more closely approximate her
__label__Other kidney function and a follow-up appointment in two months' time to
__label__Other meet with Helen Uren and consider creation of a native AV
__label__Other fistula or placement of a graft.

__label__Other associated with exertion.

__label__Other ASSESSMENT & PLAN
"__label__Other 87yo M with h/o Alzheimer   s vs vascular dementia, vasculopathic (carotid stenosis s/p CEA, PVD) who presents with two weeks of increasing lethargy, disorientation, gait instability and visual hallucinations."
__label__Other The etiology of this downturn remains unclear.
"__label__Other Given his normal temperature, normal CXR and normal U/A, an infectious etiology is unlikely."
"__label__Other Concern for a stroke-related etiology, either embolic or lacunar, is unlikely given CT and MRI results."
"__label__Other However, microembolic disease may be a possibility."
"__label__Other Given the relatively rapid onset of symptoms, worsening Alzheimer   s dementia is less likely, though often onset of Alzheimer   s may appear to have a rapid onset simply because a threshold of recognition by family members has been reached while the process itself was in fact more protracted."
"__label__Other As suggested in the CT results, normal pressure hydrocephalus may be a possibility, though the lack of incontinence makes this less likely."
__label__Other LP performed in the ED was diagnostic and not therapeutic for NPH.
"__label__Other One further diagnosis to consider would be an encephalopathic process, perhaps due to hypertension."
__label__Other A more psychiatric etiology should also be considered in this patient.
"__label__Other Depression can often manifest itself with lethargy and disorientation, especially in the elderly."
"__label__Other However, it is difficult to adequately assess this in the absence of a caretaker, as Mr Umstead is currently difficult to direct with questioning."
"__label__Other Dementia:  CXR, U/A negative."
__label__Other CT/MRI negative for acute embolic events.
__label__Other Most likely etiologies are worsening vascular vs Alzheimer   s dementia.
__label__Other will d/w attending
__label__Other consider psychiatric consult
__label__Other Continue Namenda for presumed Alzheimer   s
__label__Other Will consult neuro for management of Alzheimer   s and further workup of possible NPH

__label__Other  BMH Senior Health Initial Visit
"__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct CC: 79 yo man hx depression, psychosis, insomnia, CAD, syncope, HTN, DMT2, carotid stenosis, PVD, here for PCP and f/u of these and other chronic health problems"
__label__Other HPI: Patient recently presented to BMH with syncope s/p standing abruptly leading to left forhead lac.
__label__Other No seizure activity.
__label__Other He was brought to BMH where he indicated he had had 2 similar episodes in previous month.
"__label__Other Concern for cardiac orig1n given lack of posterior fossa signs, orthostasis at BMH, hx of seizure symptoms, and significant trauma."
"__label__Other He ruled out for MI, had TTE showing EF 59% but had inf."
__label__Other WMA and LA dilation.
__label__Other Cardiology was therefore consulted.
__label__Other An adenoMIBI stress test was later performed and revealed mild inf.
"__label__cad.test.before_dct lat reversible ischemia, therefore a LHCath was performed and showed moderate non-intervenable lesions in the RCA and distal PLV."
__label__Other The patient also underwent an EP study that was non-diagnostic.
__label__Other An implantable loop recorder was placed on 6/21.
__label__cad.test.before_dct Other work up of syncope included CNIs showing mild RICA stenosis; neurology consult thought these findings were unlikely to be the cause of his syncope and agreed with continued evaluation of cardiac etiologies.
"__label__Other In hospital, was noted that pt had had 40 lb weight loss over previous months."

__label__Other Endocrine w/u included nl TSH and cortstim.
__label__Other The patient had had a recent Chest and Abd CT and colonoscopy that had no evidence of pancreatic or colonic massess.
"__label__Other SPEP and BNP wnl and; his PSA was elevated at 9.56, however alk phos, bone survey, bone scan were all normal."
__label__Other The patient's nutrition and PO intake improved greatly s/p treatment for constipation with an aggressive bowel regimen.
"__label__Other Just prior to d/c, after returning from an uncomplicated EP study the patient started to exhibit inappropriate behavior (showing stool when not requested to staff) and stating bizarre thoughts (""I lost my mortal soul"")."
__label__Other Psychiatry was consulted and suspected the patient was having a psychotic episode in setting of prolonged
__label__Other hospitalization and multiple diagnostic interventions.
__label__Other It was concluded that an inpatient geri-psych hospitalization was required.
__label__Other Hospitalization done on Psych floor.
"__label__Other Per psych eval, pt had been withdrawn and depressed for 8 months with poor sleep, anhedonia, and decreased energy."
__label__Other The pt believed that he had died some time ago and was currently in hell.
"__label__Other He stated that he had been feeling that he had sinned so horribly, that God could not forgive him."
"__label__Other He stated that he had died, and then further stated that by this he meant that though he might be     physically alive, because he could not be forgiven, he was for all intents and purposes, spiritually dead."
__label__Other He had been having vivid dreams and had been told that he had exalted himself above god and for that would be punished.
"__label__Other On the inpt ward, Mr. Shepherd was started on zyprexa 5 mg which was titrated up to a dose of 20 mg qHS."
__label__Other Cymbalta was initiated and titrated up to 60mg qDay with gradual and signficant improvement in his mood.
__label__Other The patient also expressed difficulty sleeping which responded to Remeron 15mg.
"__label__Other At the time of discharge, the patient reported good appetite, adequate sleep (about 8 hours a night, occasional awakening with nocturia), and significant improvement of his depression."
"__label__Other He further noted that his thoughts of being doomed to hell were still occasionally present, though much less intense than upon admission, and he reported that he was able to  challenge this belief ""most of the time."
__label__Other Neuropsych testing performed during inpt stay showing significant cognitive impairment.
"__label__Other He had global deficits in language, memory, visual-spatial abilities, executive functioning, and attention."
__label__Other He had very poor learning of new information.

__label__Other Psychiatry scheduled for the following day.

__label__Other Dear Dr. Pagan:
__label__Other Your patient Lauren Ferrara came into the office today for a follow-up visit.
"__label__Other As you know, she has a long and complex history of peripheral vascular disease with bilateral lower extremity bypass grafts."
"__label__Other Her left lower extremity bypass graft had occluded once previously, but was successfully restored by Dr. Tejeda."
"__label__Other In 02/61, we had detected a high-grade stenosis in the distal aspect of this graft by surveillance, and she underwent revision with a local patch angioplasty."
__label__Other A subsequent ultrasound study done in 04/61 showed a widely patent graft and she has remained entirely asymptomatic.
__label__Other She is not particularly active.
__label__Other She denies any rest pain in the feet or significant claudication symptoms.
"__label__Other Recently, however, her husband had noticed some cyanosis of her left toes."
__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct She remains on low dose aspirin in addition to Lipitor and her other medications.
__label__smoker.never She is a nonsmoker.
"__label__Other On examination today, she appeared well and in good spirits."
__label__Other Blood pressure was measured at 130/60 in the right arm.
__label__Other Lower extremity pulses are 2+ at the femoral level bilaterally.
"__label__Other On the right, there is a strong, easily appreciated pulse over her popliteal to dorsalis pedis bypass graft, and the foot is warm and well perfused."
"__label__Other On the left, I could not appreciate a pulse over her bypass graft incisions."
"__label__Other The left foot is slightly cooler than the right, and there are some mild cyanotic changes on the first toe in particular."
__label__Other There are no frank or impending ulcerations or areas of irreversible ischemia.
__label__Other There is a strong Doppler signal obtained over the posterior tibial artery at the ankle with an occlusion pressure of approximately 100 mmHg.
__label__Other This yields an ankle index of nearly 0.7 and maybe falsely elevated.
__label__Other A follow-up ultrasound study was performed in the vascular laboratory today.
__label__Other The right lower extremity bypass remains widely patent.
"__label__Other As suspected, the left lower extremity bypass has now demonstrated to be occluded."
__label__Other Ms. Ferrara left lower extremity bypass graft has occluded sometime during the last several months and her collateralization is clearly more marginal.
"__label__Other At the present time, she does not have any clear-cut symptoms of critical limb ischemia, though the slight discoloration of her toes is a clear sign."
__label__Other The previous history of this graft including a prior thrombosis requiring thrombectomy and multiple revisions would not board well for any attempted thrombolysis or repeated rescue of this particular conduit.
"__label__Other Conversely, she has already had all of her lower extremity veins used for bypass operations and any redo bypass would be technically complicated."
__label__Other I will need to review her previous angiograms from earlier this year to determine the status of her runoff and what the alternatives might be.
"__label__Other At the present time, however, she appears to have marginal, though reasonable collateralization and is essentially asymptomatic."
__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct I think it would be reasonable to increase her antithrombotic therapy and I added a daily dose of Plavix to supplement a baby aspirin.
"__label__Other I spent sometime discussing the signs of worsening ischemia including more diffuse cyanotic skin changes of the toes, rest pain, or ulceration."
"__label__Other At a minimum, I will see her back in two months for reexamination, but I strongly encouraged the patient and her husband to contact us soon if there are any symptoms that suggest worsening of her circulation."
"__label__Other If her collateralization can remain stable, it certainly would be preferable to avoid having to consider a complex redo bypass with very limited remaining vein in this patient."
__label__Other Thank you again for allowing us to participate in her care.
__label__Other Please do not hesitate to contact me if I can be of further assistance.
"__label__Other Sincerely,"

__label__Other ASSESSMENT &amp; PLAN
"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct Mrs. Ito is a 69F with a history of CHF (EF 40%, no home O2), DM type 2, HTN, nephritic syndrome, and 1/15/2075 R humerus ORIF presenting from Crest Nursing Home with SOB and HTN."
"__label__Other Her exam and imaging is consistent with pulmonary edema, as she has had in the past."
"__label__Other The precipitant of her flash pulmonary edema is less clear, however."
__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct She describes waking up acutely short of breath and was found to be profoundly hypertensive.
"__label__hypertension.mention.after_dct It is possible that HTN 2/2 a change in her diet or fluid intake at rehab, ischemia, increases renin-aldo, or other cause led to flash pulmonary edema."
"__label__hypertension.mention.after_dct Conversely, however, CHF may have precipitated her HTN."
__label__Other Shortness of breath/CHF: Evidence of volume overload by exam and imaging.
"__label__Other PE also on the differential but seems less likely given improvement of resp status, negative LENIs."

__label__Other RADIOLOGY/STUDIES:
__label__Other      1.
__label__Other Scattered punctate foci of DWI hyperintensity that are not
"__label__Other      well evaluated on ADC or exponential images, in the right MCA/PCA"
__label__Other      border zone distribution.
__label__Other Given the pattern of signal
"__label__Other      abnormality, these most likely represent subacute infarcts, with"
__label__Other      possible subacute on chronic right posterior corona radiata
__label__Other      infarct.
__label__Other 2.
__label__Other Evidence of prior right MCA territory infarct and chronic
__label__Other      small vessel ischemic disease.
__label__Other 3.
__label__Other No hemodynamically significant stenosis of the extracranial or
__label__Other      intracranial circulation.
__label__Other ASSESSMENT &amp; PLAN
"__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct 75 yo woman with a history of stroke, HTN who presents with L arm numbness."
"__label__Other While her deficits appear to have resolved, arguing against stroke, she clearly has multiple punctate foci of DWI hyperintensity that would be consistent with acute stroke."
__label__Other These strokes are in the PCA region and at the watershed region of the MCA/PCA and so could represent both anterior and posterior circulation emboli.
"__label__Other Given that her carotid arteries are relatively clear, her heart or arch may be possible sources of embolus."
__label__Other - Has had stroke workup in the past that has been unrevealing
__label__Other - Would benefit from a repeat echocardiogram to assess for any new vegetations or thrombi
__label__Other - Would also benefit from repeat Holter to assess for paroxysmal atrial fibrillation
__label__Other - Admit to Internal Medicine service

"__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct HPI: As you know, Ms. Klein is a 74 yo RH woman with history of HTN, hyperlipidemia, CAD s/p LAD stent (2144), migraine, who was in her USOH until the afternoon of 2/6/50 when she experienced sudden onset of garbled speech and difficulty ""expressing myself"" while cooking lunch for she and her husband."
"__label__Other This episode was accompanied shortly thereafter by a dull, L fronto-temporal headache that persisted for several hours."
__label__Other She states she did not have word-finding difficulties but simply had trouble articulating herself.
__label__Other In particular she related several examples of semantic paraphasic errors.
__label__Other The episode came on suddenly and lasted 1-2 hours before she resolved back to baseline.
"__label__Other In addition to headache, associated symptoms included generalized weakness, feeling cold and mildly nauseated."
"__label__Other She denied visual changes, chest pain, sob, palpitations, lightheadedness, vertigo, difficulty with swallowing, coordination or gait."
"__label__Other She describes having a glass of orange juice with the thought that her sugar might be low, without apparent effect."
__label__Other She recalled one similar episode ~ 2 years ago at which time she had her husband drive her home and she went to bed.
"__label__Other The speech difficulty had resolved by morning, and she apparently never told her physician or had any further work-up."
"__label__Other She has no known history of seizures but migraines occur 1-2x/year, last 30 minutes to several hours and are typically preceeded by scintillating scotoma (   jagged horizontal lines   ), associated with nausea/photophobia, and relieved by sleep."
"__label__diabetes.a1c.during_dct Given her multiple vascular risk factors, she was admitted for TIA work-up which was unremarkable with the exception of mildly elevated HbA1c (7.0) including lipids, ESR, homocysteine, lipoprotein (a), TTE and holter."
__label__Other CT/CT-a and MRI did not show any evidence of acute stroke or significant cervical or intracranial arterial stenosis.
"__label__medication.aspirin..after_dct She was discharged on her home medications, which included ASA 325mg po qd, with a diagnosis of complex migraine."
"__label__Other Since return home, she has had additional typical episodes of migraine, (about every 2 weeks) without the aphasia which brought her into the hospital."
"__label__Other She has tried Excedrin migraine a few times recently, with good results."

__label__Other Imaging: CT/CTA: old right parietal infarction; occluded right internal carotid artery; thrombus in right middle cerebral artery.

__label__Other Impression: 49 year-old right-handed man presenting with right MCA-distribution stroke.
__label__Other He has a prior right parietal stroke apparent by CT scan and an occluded right internal carotid artery.
__label__Other Artery-to-artery embolus from the right ICA to the right MCA represents a likely etiology for stroke in this patient.
__label__Other Recommendations:
__label__Other 1.
__label__Other Admit to CMF neurology
__label__Other 2.
__label__Other MRI with diffusion to assess distribution of stroke and whether diffusion/perfusion mismatch is present.
"__label__Other 3.	allow blood pressure to autoregulate, with approximate SBP goal 140-180."
"__label__Other When scanning done, pt should be extubated and exam followed, correlated with blood pressure."
__label__Other 4.	consider heparin if territory of infarct is not so large as to render hemorrhage into infarction too great a risk.

__label__Other It would be useful to know 
__label__Other from her ophthalmologist whether retinopathy is present.
"__label__Other It is, of course, also "
__label__Other possible that she has vascular disease involving the kidneys.
__label__Other Their symmetry and 
__label__Other the presence of proteinuria would argue against this possibility.
__label__Other The ACE 
__label__Other inhibitor in the presence of vascular disease might of course raise her serum 
__label__Other creatinine by reducing renal blood flow somewhat.
__label__Other Her loss of appetite and 
__label__Other nausea may well be related to the degree of renal failure.
"__label__Other RECOMMENDATION:  I would suggest that she see Filomena Xia, RD, a renal "
"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct dietitian, to learn a diet appropriate for renal failure as well as for her diabetes and "
__label__Other hyperlipidemia.
__label__Other This might succeed in reducing some of her nausea.
__label__Other It think it 
__label__medication.ace_inhibitor..before_dct would be worthwhile as an experiment to reduce or discontinue her Accupril and 
__label__Other perhaps  her Lasix temporarily to see whether serum creatinine falls with 
__label__Other less ACE inhibition and somewhat more fluid volume.
"__label__Other If, of course, shortness of "
"__label__Other breath worsens or edema appears, then returning to the Lasix would be "
__label__Other reasonable.
"__label__Other It might be that a longer acting, milder diuretic, such as 5 mg of "
__label__Other metolazone might help to control edema (and potassium) and reduce the 
__label__Other requirement for Lasix.
__label__Other If serum creatinine fell appreciably with less ACE and 
"__label__Other diuresis, it would reassure us that the damage was not all structural, and it might "
__label__Other be then possible to return to these medicines with less worry.
__label__Other Her anemia is no doubt related to lack of erythropoietin and would likely benefit 
__label__Other from instituting therapy with Epogen (such as 4000 units twice a week) or 
__label__Other Aranesp).
"__label__Other PLAN:  We will send a urine today for total protein to creatinine ratio, which may "
__label__Other help us decide whether the problem is mainly diabetic nephropathy.
"__label__Other If so, the "
__label__Other measures proposed would be appropriate.
__label__Other We discussed the eventual probable 
__label__Other need for dialysis (assuming no other intercurrent medical catastrophes).
__label__Other It would 
__label__Other be useful for her to visit the DCGH Renal Department (located here on our 
"__label__Other floor at 592G, along with Ms. Xia's office) to learn about modes of dialysis."
"__label__Other We discussed construction of a forearm fistula, which should be done well before "
__label__Other a need for it arises.
"__label__Other I would, in fact, recommend that she proceed to have this "
__label__Other done in the next few months.
__label__Other This could be arranged through Dr. Xaysana's office 
__label__Other or perhaps by speaking with Dr. Najee Yuan.
"__label__Other I will, of course, help with any of "
__label__Other these measures as necessary.
"__label__Other Xander Xie, M.D."
__label__Other Wanda
__label__Other Urine total protein/creatinine ratio is only 0.11 (corresponding to about 0.1 g/day or proteinuria).
"__label__Other This is a very small amount for diabetic nephropathy, and argues in favor of vascular disease."
__label__Other I would suggest getting a MRA of renal arteries to look for any main artery obstruction.
__label__Other If present it would account for the sensitivity of her creatinine to ACE or changes in hydration.

__label__Other I had the pleasure of seeing Mrs. Lindsay today in follow up at the Saint Davids Pavilion Neurology.
__label__Other I last saw her on 07/27/2112.
__label__Other She is a 72-year-old woman who is status post a right MCA distribution cortical infarct in April of 2112 with residual left hand weakness.
__label__Other Since I last saw her Mrs. Lindsay has not done very well.
__label__Other She has had multiple recent falls and her gait has become even more unsteady.
__label__Other She tends to veer to either side and does have a frequent feeling of lightheadedness.
__label__Other She has hit her head on a couple of occasions with these falls.
__label__Other Of note her blood pressure medication has been essentially doubled since I last saw her.
__label__medication.beta_blocker..after_dct She is now taking 10 mg of Zestril every day instead of five and taking Atenolol 50 mg q.d.
__label__Other instead of 25 mg p.o.
__label__Other q.d.
__label__Other She does have intermittent weakness of the left hand which is likely recrudescent of her prior stroke symptoms and not new strokes.
"__label__Other She does not have discoordination, vertigo or diplopia."
__label__Other She does have intermittent chest pains as well which she loath to bring to the attention of her physician.
"__label__Other She is reluctant to use a cane because her family states that ""her husband does not use a cane and he is older, why should she have to use a cane""."
__label__medication.thienopyridine..after_dct She has been switched to Plavix 75 mg p.o.
__label__Other from aspirin.
__label__Other This was done without my knowledge as well.
"__label__Other She continues to have difficulty ""feeling my feet"" and this has been a chronic problem for her as well."
__label__Other On examination she is alert.
__label__Other She is a garrulous and tangential historian and needs to be frequently refocussed.
__label__Other Her speech is fluent in English.
__label__Other English is her second language and she is less fluent in that language.
__label__Other Her visual fields are full to confrontation.
__label__Other Her extraocular movements are full with no nystagmus.
__label__Other Her face is symmetric other than a mild left nasolabial fold flattening.
__label__Other She has a mild left pronator drift and slowed finger tapping on the left side.
__label__Other She has no ataxia on finger-to-nose-to-finger testing.
__label__Other Her gait is slightly wide-based and unsteady.
__label__Other She can veer to either side and frequently has to hold on to someone next to her for stability.
"__label__Other IMPRESSION: I do not feel that Mrs. Lindsay has had a new embolic event, however I am quite concerned about her continued falling and difficulty with both her continued peripheral neuropathy and likely hypoperfusion."
__label__Other This appears to be pressure dependent and I would suggest that we back off on her antihypertensive medications at this time.
__label__Other In looking at her recent CBCs she has also been consistently anemic and with her complaints of chronic fatigue I think this could certainly be a factor.
__label__medication.beta_blocker..after_dct Atenolol could certainly be a factor in this as well and perhaps a different antihypertensive medication could be considered or it could be discontinued altogether.
__label__Other Furthermore with her recurrent chest pains she should seek an opinion from her primary care physician regarding this and I have counseled her to do so.
__label__Other I will see Mrs. Lindsay in follow up in 6 months time but I am available to discuss her care at any time in the interim.

__label__Other CHIEF COMPLAINT: Right buttock pain with right lower extremity radiation.
__label__Other HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS:  I had the pleasure of seeing Wendell Urquhart in follow-up today.
__label__Other He underwent right piriformis injection under fluoroscopic guidance on 06/10/2133.
__label__Other The patient reports greater than 50% improvement in his symptoms after the procedure.
__label__Other Currently the pain is intermittent.
__label__Other He describes it as sore sensation in the right buttock.
__label__Other He grades intensity of pain as 2/10 on the numerical pain scale.
__label__Other The symptoms are worse with prolonged walking for more than 2 miles a day and completely alleviated with rest.
__label__Other There is no change in the intensity of symptoms with Valsalva maneuver.
"__label__Other The patient denies any recent fever or chills, no loss of bowel or bladder control, no numbness, no weakness, no unexplained weight loss."
"__label__Other REVIEW OF MEDICAL HISTORY: During today's visit, I have reviewed past medical, social and family history, medication list and allergies."
__label__Other There has been no interval change as compared to the previous visit.
__label__Other REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: Positive for musculoskeletal complains as described above.
"__label__Other No recent fever, no chills, no chest pain, no shortness of breath, no abdominal pain, no loss of bowel or bladder control, no unexplained weight loss."
__label__Other The rest of the systems were reviewed and are negative.
"__label__Other PHYSICAL EXAM: The patient is alert and oriented to time, person and place."
__label__Other His mood and affect are stable.
__label__Other He demonstrates good attention and concentration.
__label__Other He ambulates without an assistive device with normal heel strike and toe-off.
__label__Other He is able to stand on heels and toes.
__label__Other He is able to walk heel-to-toe in a straight line with intact balance.
"__label__Other There is limited range of motion in the lumbar spine with flexion limited to 80 degrees, extension limited to 20 degrees."
"__label__Other There is no tenderness to palpation over piriformis muscles, paraspinal muscles, spinous processes, SI joints, or greater trochanteric bursa bilaterally."
__label__Other There is full 5/5 strength in the lower extremities with intact sensation bilaterally.
"__label__Other 1+ reflexes in the knees, absent reflexes in the ankles bilaterally."
"__label__Other There is downgoing Babinski, no clonus, normal tone in the lower extremities."
__label__Other Straight leg raise and femoral stretch test are negative bilaterally.
__label__Other There is pain with right hip internal rotation.
__label__Other IMPRESSION:
__label__Other 1.
__label__Other Piriformis syndrome.
__label__Other 2.
__label__Other Lumbar spondylosis with degenerative disk disease.
__label__Other 3.
__label__Other Right hip arthropathy.
__label__Other RECOMMENDATIONS:
__label__Other I had lengthy discussion with the patient about his condition and further treatment options.
__label__Other The patient will continue with home exercise program that he learned in physical therapy.
__label__Other The patient was encouraged to remain active and to participate in low-impact aerobic exercises as along as it does not exacerbate his symptoms.
__label__Other The patient was counseled on the benefits of weight reduction.
__label__Other He was informed about Weight Center here at Brooksville Regional Hospital.
__label__Other He is trying to control his weight through a balanced diet and aerobic exercises.
__label__Other He will consider an evaluation at the Weight Center if those approaches are not successful.
__label__Other 4.
__label__Other The therapeutic plan was discussed with the patient.
__label__Other All of his questions were answered.

__label__Other Dear Dr. Nall:
__label__Other It was a pleasure to see Nick again in the Internal Medicine at Wytheville South Hospital on 06/14/2098 for routine folow up of radiation associated ischemic heart disease.
"__label__cad.event.before_dct As you know, Nick had mantle radiation in his youth for Hodgkin's lymphoma, and subsequently had 2 NSTEMIs in 2087 and 2090."
"__label__cad.event.before_dct He received bare-metal stents to his LAD and RCA and did well until 2094 when after diagnosis and resection of a squamous cell lung carcinoma, his postop course was immediately complicated by an acute inferior STEMI/VT/VF arrest."
"__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct Immediate angiography post-resuscitation found massive thrombus burden in his proximal right coronary artery, with good result after thrombectomy and POBA, in addition to Integrilin, aspirin, Plavix, and low dose heparin."
"__label__Other Remarkably, after an IABP and aggressive care Nick walked away with a preserved LV function after this event."
__label__cad.event.before_dct He did well until 01/2095 when he represented with unstable angina and was found to have in-stent restenosis in the ostial LAD and the ostial RCA bare-metal stents.
__label__cad.event.before_dct He was treated with Cypher drug-eluting stents to both lesions (3.5 x 18 mm Cypher stent post dilated to 20 atm to the LAD and 3.5 x 23 mm extending slightly into the sinus of Valsalva to the RCA) with no residual stenosis.
__label__medication.thienopyridine..after_dct Because of concerns with regards to recurrent in-stent restenosis he was put on dual antiplatelet therapy (325mg ECASA and clopidogrel 150 mg) since that event intended as longterm therapy.
"__label__Other He has been followed by me since 2095 with no recurrent ischemic heart disease, chest pain, and has returned to normal exercise capacity and with preserved cardiac systolic function."
__label__Other Nick continues to be very successful as a technology consultant in IBM research in Leland.
"__label__Other As the economy is picking up, his work environment has improved as has his stress level."
__label__Other He is walking every day both at work and recreationally and lost another 5pounds.
__label__medication.ace_inhibitor..during_dct He takes his medications regularly and is usually compliant  but ran out of atenolol last week and instead has been taking bid ramipril in its place.
__label__medication.thienopyridine..after_dct Every year he asks whether we can down-titrate his clopidogrel both for tolerance and cost reasons (I reassured him that it should be generic within a year).
"__label__Other Nevertheless, we tested the degree of platelet inhibition he currently has with the VerifyNow P2Y12 PRU assay, and his result was 177, which is below the cut-off of 230 PRU thought to approximate adequate platelet inhibition."
__label__Other He recently had some transient melena for which he was placed on ranitidine.
__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct His current medications should be aspirin 325 mg p.o.
"__label__medication.thienopyridine..after_dct daily, clopidogrel 150 mg p.o."
"__label__medication.statin..before_dct daily, atorvastatin 80 mg p.o."

"__label__medication.beta_blocker..during_dct daily, atenolol 50 mg p.o."

"__label__Other daily, ranitidine 150 mg po daily, 1 tablet fish oil daily, and 1 tablet of vitamin D daily."

"__label__Other To target his coronary risk factors, I recommended the following:"
__label__Other 1.
__label__medication.statin..after_dct Should his LDL be &gt;70mg/dL he should switch to rosuvastatin 40mg daily for LDL and HDL improvement.
__label__Other 2.
__label__Other Given clopidorel platelet reactivity is less than 230 PRU he will decrease to 75 mg daily and we will re-check his PRU activity after at least 7 days on this dose.
__label__medication.thienopyridine..after_dct Should PRU &gt; 230 he will either need to restart 150 mg daily and take a PPI like pantoprazole or switch to prasugrel (or when available ticagrelor).
__label__Other 3.
__label__Other He will continue a healthy heart diet and exercise and we will see him again in 6 months.

__label__Other History of Present Illness: 74 yo M who comes to the office in search of a second opinion about his care at the Boaz Nursing Home in Lynden.
__label__Other He has a hx of prostate CA diagnosed in 2059 at the BNH and had an RRP shortly thereafter at the BNH.
__label__Other Apparently his pathology showed extraprostatic extension and he received postop XRT.
"__label__Other Apparently, he has remained disease free since this time until a PSA was checked this past October which was 3.53."
"__label__Other He states that he had not had his PSA checked for a few years before this, admittedly perhaps because he had missed appointments."
"__label__Other The Urologists at the BNH have since checked a bone scan and abdominal CT scan, all of which were negative."
__label__Other He has the reports here with him.
"__label__Other The bone scan does show an abnormality at L5, but with data from plain films this appears to not be consistent with a met lesion."
__label__Other He also has had recurrent problems with bleeding from hemorrhagic radiation cystitis.
__label__Other This occurs once every few months or so and is not currently bothering him.
"__label__Other He states that he is scheduled to have a cystoscopy at the BNH next week, however, is unsure if he has had a urine cytology done."
"__label__Other Impression: In reviewing the patient's limited records that he brings and his history, it appears that he has had the appropriate care at the BNH."
"__label__Other I have reassured him of this, and have indicated that he should just make sure that a urine cytology is also checked and that a repeat PSA be performed in the near future."
__label__Other I also informed him that he will likely need anti-androgen therapy in the future for further treatment of his prostate CA.
__label__Other He may follow up with me if he has questions in the future.

__label__Other The issues include:
__label__Other Congestive heart failure     I suspect there is worsening fluid retention primarily due to his worsening renal function.
__label__Other I would consider:
__label__Other increasing his diuretic (eg.
__label__Other Lasix 80 mg iv bid) to improve diuresis and get him euvolemic.
"__label__Other Hopefully this will work; if not, he should have ultrafiltration so that he is not in heart failure for his operation."
"__label__Other He will be at high risk of CHF post-op, and likely will need an ICU bed"
__label__Other consider starting hydralazine/nitroglycerin combination in lieu of ACE-inhibitor for afterload reduction
